question.text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I : CeO2 can be used for oxidation of aldehydes and ketones.

Statement II : Aqueous solution of EuSO4 is a strong reducing agent. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Both Statement I and Statement II are false
Statement I is false but Statement II is true

solution.text: The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> oxidation state of lanthanide is most stable and therefore lanthanide in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math> oxidation state has strong tendency to gain <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math> and converted into <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and therefore act as strong oxidizing agent. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>e</mi><mo>.</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>.</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Ce</mi><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></math> And therefore <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CeO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is used to oxidized alcohol aldehyde and ketones. Lanthanide in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math> oxidation state has strong tendency to loss <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math> and converted into <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> oxidation state therefore act as strong reducing agent. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>∴</mo><msub><mi>EuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> act as strong reducing agent.
